paragraphs.text: Kartavya was founded in 1999 by a group of students from IIT (ISM) Dhanbad, led by Mr. Amresh Mishra, who later joined the Indian Police Service (IPS). The areas surrounding the campus of the college were home to several slums. Children from these communities would often gather near the hostels to collect leftover food and roam around the campus in search of recyclable garbage.

Moved by their situation, Mr. Mishra along with other students began educating these children. The first classes were conducted in a temple located in Lahbani Basti, Dhaiya. As the initiative grew, Kartavya established its own building, which came to be known as Centre 1, Dhanbad and later on other centres were also established.

With primary focus on education of children, Kartavya gradually expanded its mission to address broader social issues, including vocational training, womenâ€™s empowerment (with the aim of reducing social and economic inequality), and healthcare.
